weatherForecast.comment:
It will remain mostly clear on Monday night, with clouds gathering from the west in the morning. A warm front will soon bring dense clouds and some snowfall on the northern side of the Alps from midday. The frost will weaken significantly and the snowfall level will rise to 1400 metres by the evening.
The temperature will rise from -10 degrees in the morning to -1 degrees in the evening. The wind is still blowing strongly from the north-west.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Significant avalanche danger in all aspects! Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is considerable above the tree line (level 3) and moderate below. Fresh snowdrift accumulations in all aspects and in some places down to forest aisles can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in many places behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls even with a small additional load.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 60 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday, partly interspersed with graupel. Stormy westerly to north-westerly winds have brought the snow to the eastern sectors on a large scale, but locally all directions and also forest aisles below the tree line can be affected. The fresh wind slab snow may contain weak layers and usually lies on an unstable layer of faceted crystals or surface hoar. In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Tuesday will be mild and the clouds will soften. The danger level changes little, but naturally triggered avalanches occur more frequently due to the warming.

weatherForecast.comment:
It will remain mostly clear on Monday night, with clouds gathering from the west in the morning. A warm front will bring some snowfall to the northern side of the Alps from midday. The frost will weaken significantly and the snowfall level will rise to 1400 metres by the evening.
The temperature will rise from -10 degrees in the morning to -1 degrees in the evening. The wind is still blowing strongly from the north-west.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Moderate avalanche danger above the tree line. Even a single person can trigger a slab avalanche!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is moderate above the tree line (level 2) and low below. Fresh snowdrift accumulations, mainly in the north, east and south sectors, but locally also in other aspects and in forest aisles, can be triggered as medium slab avalanches in some places behind ridgelines, terrain edges and in gullies and bowls even with a small additional load.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 30 cm of new fallen snow has fallen since Thursday, partly interspersed with graupel. Stormy westerly to north-westerly winds have brought the snow to the eastern sectors on a large scale, but locally all directions and also forest aisles below the tree line can be affected. The fresh wind slab often lies on an unstable layer of faceted crystals or surface hoar. In the foundation of the snow cover, kinetic metamorphism (floating snow) weakens the stability.

tendency.highlights: Tuesday will be mild and the clouds will soften. The avalanche risk will change only slightly for the time being.

weatherForecast.comment:
It will remain mostly clear on Monday night, with clouds moving in from the west in the morning, but it will remain mostly precipitation-free. The frost will weaken significantly and the snowfall level will rise to 1400 metres by the evening.
The temperature will rise from -10 degrees in the morning to -4 degrees in the evening. The wind is still blowing briskly from the north-west.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, but watch out for fresh wind slab!
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. However, fresh snowdrift accumulations in gullies and bowls and behind ridges and ridgelines above the tree line are prone to disruption and can be triggered by individuals as small slab avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment: Fresh snowdrift accumulations often lie on faceted crystals or surface hoar, which can act as a weak layer. Apart from this, the old snow surface is covered by a few centimetres of new fallen snow. In general, kinetic metamorphism weakens the thin snow base, fundament. Windward terrain is usually blown off and almost snow-free.

tendency.highlights: Tuesday will be mild and the clouds will soften. The avalanche risk remains low.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Beware of fresh wind slab in all aspects! Considerable avalanche danger in places!
